creator: randal@satx.rr.com
text:
I installed the phphome2.3.4 recently and uninstalled Apache1.3 opting to 
upgrade not only Apache, but PHP to 5.0 using the triad version.

Now, when one goes to a directory/folder with no index.html the icons are not 
present. When I move the icons into my root /www or any other folder and try to 
view, you get a Error 404 code, yet when I go into Windows Explorer and right 
click and ask to open in IE, they show. Confusing...!?

Here are two places to try to view the icons in either IE or Mozilla...

http://www.geikiedesigns.com/icons/

http://www.kayakingbear.com/icons/


Here is example of my httpd.conf file

http://www.geikiedesigns.com/httpd.txt

Here is my example of error log file...

http://www.geikiedesigns.com/geikiedesigns.com-error.log.txt

Not sure if this is a bug but cannot explain this behavior.


(also... when I firs filled out this form, I decided to put in some keywords 
for you and accidently added one not on the list and had to hit my back button. 
All my typing and edits were gone and had to start form from scratch! Why not 
set this form up to save all that typing and work so one does not have to re-
type??!!!)

thanks,

randal

creator: randal@satx.rr.com
text:
By the way, I did put an icons folder in not only my root, but the apache2 root 
and everywhere else an error report showed it needed to be.

This is a configuration issue and not a bug report, so you should address it to
a user-support forum like the users@httpd.apache.org mailing list.  You'll find
people very willing to help there.
creator: slive@apache.org
